item.title: CITIGROUP | Fired 3,500 employees in China
item.description: The US bank citigrigoup fired about 3,500 technology division employees in mainland China, as part of a global cost reduction strategy and operational restructuring, Jornal Financial Times said yesterday. The cuts affect a division based in the cities of Shanghai and Dalian, responsible for the provision of computer services to Citigroup operations in more than 20 countries. According to the bank, some of the jobs will be relocated to other countries, "to be closer to the business and products they support," without, however, revealing numbers or concrete destinations. The financial institution also indicated that the process should be completed "at the beginning of the fourth quarter." "Although there is still work to do, many of our efforts have enabled the efficiency of our way of operating, our workforce and the global presence in infrastructure," said Marc Luet, Citi's head to Japan, North Asia and Australia, quoted by the Financial Times. The bank, which has been present in mainland China since 1902, has ensured that the decision will not have an impact on the banking operations of its Chinese subsidiary, headquartered in Shanghai, nor the Canton -based technology team that continues to provide services to mainland China and Hong Kong. Third largest United States Bank in terms of assets, Citigroup has sought to resolve persistent operational and profitability challenges through deep restructuring, which included the dismissal of thousands of workers and a simplification of the management structure. This cut represents one of the largest discharges recorded between foreign financial groups in China in recent years, and reflects a growing trend of frame reduction in the technological area.

item.title: IDQ / Inspections | Pereira Coutinho criticizes services suspension
item.description: Deputy José Pereira Coutinho has challenged the government about changes to the services provided by the Institute for Development and Quality (IDQ), which have “implications for quality and inspection in Macao”. According to the question, the Deputy Citizens Office has received many complaints from “local entrepreneurs who express concern about the recent decision of the IDQ to suspend the provision of various essential services”, such as the “inspection of lifting equipment and the issuance of inspection certificates for private companies, as well as for their engineering projects”. This change took place from March last year, and for Pereira Coutinho, “without notice, this decision raises several questions about the continuity of essential services that guarantee safety and quality in the construction sector, lifting equipment and engineering in Macao”. The deputy also questions "how will be guaranteed in the future the fulfillment of various purposes of IDQ."

item.title: Iam | More than 60 products with export facilities
item.description: More than 50 types of Macao foods have been covered by the “Cooperation Agreement in the Safety Control of food products manufactured in Macao and exported to the interior of China” since it was signed by the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) with China entities in 2019. According to an AMI note, besides these foods, “about 10 types of meat products were recommended by AMI to China's General Customs Administration to be successfully registered” in the country, such as “traditional pastry products, ready -to -eat swallow nests, meat products, among others”, under the “memorandum over sanitary inspection and the veterinary requirements for meat products exported by macao to China ”, signed in 2023. Chinese entities that have established cooperation with Macau are the General Management of China Customs and the Secretariat for Administration and Justice, creating “an innovative model of cooperative supervision”.

item.title: Alliance Française | Presented today documentary about Maria Callas
item.description:
It is today that the public can remember one of the great voices of our time, Maria Callas, and also know more about your life. This is because the Alliance Française de Macau hosts the exhibition of the documentary “Callas - Paris, 1958”, by French director Tom Volf. The exhibition takes place in the context of the French May festival, in partnership with Hong Kong
The Alliance Française de Macau, in collaboration with the Alliance Française de Hong Kong and French May Arts Fest, today in Macau the documentary film “Callas-Paris, 1958”, by Tom Volf, dating from 2023. The exhibition takes place from 7:30 pm in Studio City's room 4, integrating in the “French May Cinema Program” section ”section” section French May festival. According to a press release of the organization, "the exhibition will be preceded by a presentation by Michel Reis, Melómane, author and host of Radio Macau's Classical Music Program," Scherzo ", and Peter Gordon, who has lived in Hong Kong since 1985 and works with the main opera companies of Hong Kong and Guangdong." The film documents the premiere of “one of the greatest legends of opera, the quintessential diva, media sensation and face of twentieth -century opera, the extremely rare soprano 'plague'” Maria Callas in France. This was the concert in which Maria Callas was accompanied by the Orchestre de L'Epéra Nationale de Paris and Choeurs, under the direction of conductor Georges Sébastian, "a show that became a real legend." It was, according to the same note, a show that integrated a gala of charity in favor of the works of “Légion d'Honneur”, being broadcast live on French television and televisions from other European countries through Eurovision, which was quite rare at the time. Announced by the press as "Le Plus Grand Spectacle du Monde" [the largest show in the world], "The concert was really exceptional." Celebration order The film was commissioned by Fondação Callas, through the Maria Callas Donations Fund, created by Volf himself, for the celebration of the centenary of the birth of the celebrated Greco American sopranic, which was marked on December 2, 2023. The foundation was created in Paris in 2017 by the world-known conductor Georges Prêtre, who developed a very close working relationship with the singer, who directed several times. This documentary took six years to complete and two years to color. Volf was also the author of the critical documentary “Maria by Callas”, released in 2017 in more than 40 countries, which won awards at film festivals in Europe and the US. He also launched three books about the singer: “Maria by Callas”, “Callas Confidential” and “Maria Callas: Memoirs & Letters”. In the show chosen for this documentary, Maria Callas came up "with her most elegant sewing high couture clothing worth more than one million US dollars," the chosen repertoire "showed Callas at its heyday, both in recital and actress." “It is noteworthy that he had sung 'Violetta' in a production of 'La Traviata' in Lisbon at the beginning of this year of 1958, at the famous São Carlos National Theater, considered his best Violetta of the more than 60 he played,” he reads. Comments by famous actor and animator Pierre Tchernia, known as “Magic Tchernia”, were complemented by Pierre Dumayet during the intervals, both behind the scenes during the scenario changes, which conducted numerous interviews with figures such as Jean Cocteau, Patachou, Brigitte Bardot, Gilbert Bécaud, Zizi, Zizi Jeanmaire and Roland Petit, as well as Beguum Aga Khan, a program run by Roger Benarm entitled “La Grande Nuit de L'Opéra” [The Great Night of the Opera], under the tutelage of the Institut National de L'Audiovisuel (Ina). The original filming of the concert were restored to the modern large screens by producer and a specialist in coloring and restoration of files and archive images, Samuel François-Steininger, from original 16mm coils, which, along with the matrix ribbons, were recently discovered in the Calla recordings file itself. The documentary aired Friday was produced in French with English subtitles and "shows the iconic opera singer at the height of her fame, preserving her voice in all her colors and amplitude for posterity." “In the performance, visual elements are as important as the vocal dimensions in their art. Present in color, 4K resolution and surround dolby atmos, Tom Volf's meticulous work provided the public with a modern immersion in this historical action,” reads the same note.

item.title: Housing | Market shrinks more than 50% in a year
item.description:
The housing market continues in contraction and within one year the average price of the square meter devalued 23.8 percent. If the comparison is made with the pre-pound period, prices fell 39.5 percent
In early May, the number of transactions in the housing market dropped to less than half, with a 57.6 percent reduction compared to the first half of May last year. The information is contained in the Statistics of the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF). According to the most recent data, in the first half of May this year there was a total of 78 purchases and housing sales, which contrasts with the 184 transactions recorded in the first fifteen days of May 2024. This is a difference of 106 businesses. The changes in the space of one year did not become the number of transactions, the same happened with the average price of the square meter. In the first half of May this year the average housing price was 69,634 patacas per square meter, which means a 23.8 percent reduction compared to the same period, when the average price was 91,361 patacas per square meter. The reduction means that if a person paid, last year, 5.80 million patacas for a housing, the same house would be worth 4.42 million patacas, which implies a devaluation of 1.38 million patacas. In early May this year, Coloane was the region with the most expensive houses, where the average price was 90,755 patacas per square meter. Instead, on the Macao peninsula the average price per square meter was 69,132 patacas per square meter, the smallest. Other realities If the comparison is made with the first half of April this year, the reduction at both the number of transactions and the price is more moderate. In terms of housing price, within one month the reduction was 11 percent, given that at the beginning of April this year the average price of the square meter was set at 78,204 patacas. When analyzing the tendency to the number of transactions, the reduction was 34.6 percent, greater than one third, since in early April had been registered with the DSF a total of 133 transactions. The latest number of transactions was only 78 purchases and sales, which means a difference of 55 transactions. Comparisons with the pre-pound period show an even more pronounced contrast. At the level of the square meter, the comparison with the beginning of May 2019 shows a 39.5 percent reduction from 115,071 patacas per square meter to 69,634 patacas per square meter. Given these numbers, if a person had compared a housing in early May 2019 for 5.80 million patacas, this same house would now be valued at 3.51 million patacas, a difference of 2.29 million patacas.

item.title: Real Estate | Associative leader calls for immigration to respond to the crisis
item.description:
The General Association of Macao Real Estate Sector believes that the territory needs more qualified immigrants to reverse the contraction of the real estate market. However, IP Kun Wa was disillusioned with the lines of government action for not seeing a commitment to market stabilization
The president of the General Association of Macao Real Estate Sector, IP Kun Wa, admits the disappointment with the first lines of governing action of the Executive of Sam Hou Fai, considering that measures are lacking to support the real estate market. The position was taken in statements made to the newspaper or world. According to the president of the association, the government needs to facilitate the requirements to attract qualified labor from outside, as immigration is regarded as the board of salvation to the real estate market. In the representative's view, if the territory has more people, with strong purchase capacity, it will increase the demand for housing in Macao. The associative leader also acknowledged that the real estate market is currently in a contraction phase, due to the lack of confidence of consumers who believe that if they buy a property that will lose value in the nearest times. However, the Association's president warned that, unlike Hong Kong, in Macau there is no scholarship market. As such, and given that the growth in the economy implies increased consumption, the real estate market is one of the few roads for residents to invest their savings, gain greater confidence and help develop the local economy. Given this vision, IP Kun Wa considered that the government lines were a disappointment because they only contain “some slight phrases” about the need to allow more immigrants to enter and to streamline the approval processes of new immigrants without truly details. Long -term measures Regarding the government lines and the proposals for real estate, with the exception of emigration, IP Kun Wa recognized that it was skeptical, as proposals to promote the development of the economy are long term and, therefore, will only be reflected in the demand for more long term properties. IP Kun Wa also lamented that the Macao government was not committed to measures to stabilize the most essential markets for the economy. The president of the General Association of the Macao Real Estate Sector gave the example of the interior, where he considered that after the signs of support from the central government to the scholarship market, there were signs of stabilization and recovery, in which he understood that it was a right policy.

item.title: Game / Recipes | Baixa Review does not surprise analysts
item.description:
CreditSights analysts were not surprised by the low-year review for the gross revenue of this year's game, announced by the government on Tuesday. The most “conservative and in line with the performance of the sector” is explained by the possible drop in VIP and premium mass segments
On Tuesday, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, announced what seemed inevitable: the low review of estimates for gross game revenues by 2025. In the budgetary review proposal, the government cut expectations by 12 billion, from the initial estimate of 240 billion to 228 billion. The industry's performance rectification did not catch Creditsights analysts by surprise. In a note released yesterday, analysts Nicholas Chen and David Bussey state that the review “was not a complete surprise”, “taking into account the weak monthly gross revenue record since the beginning of the year” to meet the goal of 240 billion patacas at the end of 2025. In fact, the institution adds that the new target "is more conservative and in line with the annual performance of the sector so far." Despite the encouraging numbers of tourists who have visited Macau this year, the growth of the flow of visitors has not been reflected in the game's gross recipes, analysts pointed out. “We suspect that this is due to the greater prevalence of players in the mass segment, to the detriment of gamblers from the VIP segments and premium mass, as well as the climb of non-game elements,” says the note, quoted by the GGR Asia portal. Rays of sun The results of the casinos last month did not pass along the analysis released yesterday. The casinos raised gross revenues of 21.19 billion patacas in May, the highest value since the pandemic, ie since January 2020 when 22.13 billion of patacas were determined. “The robust record of visitors during the five days of May 1 holidays,” which supported the May's gross revenues were viewed as a positive signal, since thanks to last month the monthly average revenue of gross revenues rose to 19.5 billion patacas, 500 million patacas above the monthly monthly revenues of the new government estimate. It is also mentioned that the growth in the number of visitors has helped compensate for the reduction of the amount of bets. As such, analysts warn that "the game sector may still risk not meeting the new goal for revenue if the number of tourists shows signs of weakening." In terms of accumulated revenue, in the first five months of this year there was an increase of 1.7 percent compared to the previous year, with a total of 97.71 billion of patacas compared to 96.06 billion recorded between January and May last year. However, the value is still far away from 2019 and before the junkets campaign, when revenues between January and May were 125.69 billion Patacas.

item.title: Elections | “Soldier of Mao”
item.description:
Wong Wai Man gave yesterday the request for recognition of his list to run for legislative elections after the 2021 candidacy was refused. The potential candidate made his electoral race yesterday, dressed in rigor, with employment and social welfare among political priorities
The "Soldier of Mao" is back. Wong Wai Man was yesterday to the Public Administration building to deliver to the Electoral Affairs Committee of the Legislative Assembly (CAEAL) the request for recognition of the filing of the candidacy for legislative elections of 14 September. The president of the Iron and Steel and Steel Association of the list helps Mutual Grassroots came with a dress similar to the red guards uniforms during the cultural revolution and wearing a bag with the image of Mao Tsé-Tung. This is the third time it seeks to enter the voting report and, this time, delivered 395 signatures with the request for recognition of the list of the list that must have six candidates. Appearing a calm stance, Wong Wai Man claimed to be calm about the scrutiny of the authorities in the face of the criteria to be fulfilled by his list, namely in relation to the minimum number of sufficient signatures to be able to participate in the suffrage. "I am not concerned, my goal is to participate in the electoral process. I dedicate myself to civic and social participation for about 18 years. I do not need to assume the position of deputy, my strength and positive energy are greater than any deputy," said the potential candidate, quoted by All About Macau. The many battles "Today, in Macao there have been many cases of suicide, with people jumping into the sea or top of buildings, or by hanging. The rulers have responsibilities to this reality, as well as the 32 deputies who are in the Legislative Assembly," said Wong Wai Man in a video shared at Wechat. Increased suicides in the territory is viewed by the potential candidate as a consequence of economic and employment difficulties that affect part of the population. "If people have a good job and economic ability to pay the bills, their lives improve and the concerns disappear," he said. As such, the “Mao Soldier” pointed to employment as one of his political priorities. In addition, Wong Wai Man also promised to give priority to the most disadvantaged segments of the population. "Whether it wins, or not, my wish is to help the poor. I don't want to help all residents. Chan Meng Kam and Sam Hou Fai are also residents and don't need help," he said.

item.title: Environment | Macau registers a new maximum temperatures in 2024
item.description:
The direction of environmental protection services yesterday launched new data on the environmental landscape in the territory, in the Macao Encounters of the Macao 2024. The data is not encouraging: last year a new record of maximum temperatures, more rain and typhoons were recorded. More electricity and water was spent, more garbage was produced and fewer recyclable waste was collected
Lame The Government of Macao, through the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) announced yesterday that 2024 reached a maximum temperature record in the territory, and there was also an increase in typhoons and precipitation. According to the Macau 2024 state report, the average temperature last year was 23.6 ° C, precisely the value that had been reached in 2019, the highest since the records began, in 1952. The average temperature of 2024 was 0.8 ° C higher than the average climacteric (average of 30 years, between 1991 and 2020), according to the document prepared by DSPA. In addition, Macau registered 42 days considered to be hot last year, more 10.7 days than the climacteric average, 29 hot nights, more 17.5 than the average, and 29 cold days, less 10.1 days than the average. Meteorological and geophysical services (SMG) classify as hot days when the maximum temperature is equal to or greater than 33ºC and the nights at which the minimum temperature is at least 28ºC. As for the days considered cold, they are those at which the minimum temperature does not exceed 12ºC. "With global warming, the occurrence of extreme weather phenomena is increasingly frequent," said DSPA in the report. In 2024, Macau was affected by seven tropical cyclones, known as tuffons, and for the first time three tropical cyclones affected Macao in November, the last month of the Typhoons, which begins in May. According to the report, the region last year received a total precipitation of 2,029.2 millimeters, "slightly higher than the climacteric average." DSPA also said that since 1970, sea level in Macao has risen at an average rate of about 3.5 millimeters per year. Also worldwide, 2024 was the hottest year that there are records and exceeded for the first time the 1.5 ° C above the pre-industrial level, in January the copernicus European service advanced in January. Last week, the world weather organization predicted that temperatures should continue to reach record values ​​by the end of the decade. More people, more expenses The DSPA report also tells that with the arrival of more tourists to Macau, there were also more waste and spending on water consumption, for example. "With the improvement of the economy, the number of visitors in 2024 increased 23.8 percent in annual terms for almost 35 million, having recovered about 90 percent of the pre-pound level. Tourist intensity also registered a certain increase, with GDP [Gross Domestic Product] climbed 8.8 percent. In addition, there was a slight increase in the population at the end of the year." Thus, it is added, "in relation to environmental indicators, economic and population growth led to the rise of estimated local emissions of greenhouse gases, invoiced water volume, electricity consumption and the amount of urban solid waste, compared to 2023". "During the pandemic, there was a decrease in the various economic and environmental indicators. However, with the constant improvement of the economy, most of these indicators rose again," is explained. With regard to the volume of invoiced water, in thousands of cubic meters, by 2023 the record was 89,164 and last year, 94.123, which constitutes an increase of 5.6 percent. Regarding electricity consumption, in millions of kW/h, in 2023 it was 5,740, while in 2024 consumption went to 6,030, plus 5.1 percent. The report also highlights the tons of urban solid waste produced, which in 2023 was 501,512, rising 5.1 percent last year to 526,979 tons. Another worrying fact of waste level was the fall, for the third consecutive year, the volume of recyclable waste collected, which went from 24.5 percent at 2021 to 21.7 percent last year. Changed for kids, of all recyclable waste generated in Macao, only about one fifth are collected for recycling. In the report, IP Kuong Lam, director of DSPA, indicates that last year, "with the ongoing economic recovery, there was greater pressure on various environmental indicators, while climate change became more severe." Despite the results, the official said that the objectives are "to encourage greater participation of the population in environmental initiatives and together to achieve the view of building a macao with low carbon emissions." A question of gases The report released yesterday by DSPA also accounts for the panorama of greenhouse gases (GHG) gases, and last year, a global increase of “about ten percent, including carbon dioxide (C02), which represented 90 percent”. It also highlights DSPA that “the estimated emissions of GHE from the various sources have registered upon the same period (2023), except for landfill residues, and the most significant increases were verified in estimated emissions from local electricity production and air transport”. In addition, it is stated that, in 2024, the main source of Emission of GHG and CO2 was land transport, followed by local electricity production, waste incineration, trade, domestic consumption and services. "The main sources of CH4 emissions [methane] were the waste deposited in landfills and the treatment of wastewater, while the latter was also the main source of N2O emission [nitrous oxide]," he stresses in the document. DSPA clarifies, regarding the tendency of GHG emissions, that "after reaching the peak in 2017, local Emissions of GHG showed a decreasing tendency, year after year, having reached its lower value during the pandemic." However, with the recovery of economic activities and the great movement of people, especially "in the last two years, the estimated emissions of these gases has gradually rise again." The air we breathe Also with regard to air quality data is not encouraging, because in 2024 “the number of days with the average quality of air classified as 'good' or 'moderate' recorded in the six Macao air quality monitoring stations reached 88 percent, slightly lower than 2023”. There was, in a total of the year, 15 to 34 days with “unhealthy” classification, and only two days obtained the classification of “very unhealthy”. According to DSPA, “the pollutants detected in the air monitoring stations were mainly ozone (O3) and thin particles suspended (PM2.5)”, while “at Berma da Estrada station (Ká-Hó), the highest index detected all year round, classified as 'very unhealthy', was the O3 the main pollutant”. Last year, July was the best air quality month, while October to December obtained the worst qualification according to data from Macao air monitoring stations. The report also reveals that “in terms of compliance with atmospheric pollutant concentrations in 2024, average annual PM10 and PM2.5 concentrations recorded in the various monitoring stations were lower than standard values”, while “the average annual nitrogen dioxide concentrations (NO2) also set below standard values, except for Road Berma measures (Macao) and at the High Density Areas station (Macau) ”. More optimistic data is also revealed “daily averages of sulfur dioxide concentrations (SO2) and the maximum averages of eight hours of carbon monoxide concentrations (CO) verified in the various stations throughout the year”, as “both were below standard values”. “In all seasons there was a record of the maximum averages of eight hours of O3 concentrations to exceed standard values ​​in some days. In relation to atmospheric pollutant concentrations recorded in the monitoring stations, generally the average annual concentrations of PM2.5 and NO2, while PM10 and CO descended”, and “as in the road station season (Macao) Only in 2024 did SO2 and O3 begin to be monitored, no comparisons were made. ”

item.title: Exhibition | Local artist Cheong Kin Man presents new show in Lisbon
item.description: It is a creative path with several locations that Cheong Kin Man and Marta Sala perform in Lisbon from tomorrow: first, the show “The Slazing and Curious Travel”, to see at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center until July 6, whose launch is preceded by a conversation with artists and a book release. Then, on Friday, there is another debate at the Goethe Institute Image of: Guillaume-Galante For several years based in Berlin, Cheong Kin Man has been a visual artist and anthropologist who has never left experimentation aside. Now, alongside the Polish artist Marta Sala, has been embedded in new artistic directions, which, this time, flow into Lisbon. This happens in multiple forms. First with the show “The Slazing and Curious Travel”, which will be evident at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) between tomorrow and July 6. Curated by Lorena Tabares Salamanca, from Colombia, the show is a “cross -cultural exposure that crosses art, visual anthropology and personal archives, reflecting on displacements, memory and languages”, with the signature of Cheong Kin Man, Marta Sale and Deborah Uhde from Germany. The public can see “immersive installations, textile pieces, video and self-ethnographs that reconfigure the relations between travel, history and knowledge,” says a press release of the Poland City Council. In the inaugural session of this Thursday there will also be a conversation with the artists, which is repeated on Friday, but this time at the Goethe Institute library in Lisbon at 18h. Here, in “Creating Connections”, a conversation with the three artists of “The Slazing and Curious Travel”, which is “an intimate artistic meeting, in which Deborah Uhde, as well as the duo Marta Stanisława Sala and Cheong Kin Man, will share among themselves-and with the public-reflections on their practices and experiences in creating intercultural bonds through art, especially art, with emphasis on art. their paths in Berlin and the latest artist books. ” These initiatives are supported by the Poland Embassy in Portugal, the Ministry of Culture and National Heritage and the Adam Mickiewicz Institute of Poland. They also have the partnership of the City Council of Krakow and the Boym Institute, also from Poland. Fusions and Travel The show that now presents at CCCM brings works of the duo Cheong Kin Man - Marta Sala, known “by the fusion of fabric, video and language experiments”, in which the public can “embark on a trip through parallel worlds and personal files” based on three multimedia projects, such as “The Utopian's compass”, “Revelations” and a new cycle of Macaense diaspora. In the case of “The Utopia Compass”, it is a “bamboo and fabric installation composed of 13 textile compositions that materialize processes of cultural discovery and mutual learning”, and the work is inspired by the “Flora Sinensis” (1656), by the Jesuit Miguel Boym, who studied in Krakow; as well as “in the musicality of Cantonense poetry translated into chromatic shapes and in self-ethrical motifs associated with the migration of a Macaense family and the contemporary trips of the artists”. Also noteworthy is that the exhibition reveals “the experimental film project based on interviews within the Macaense Diaspora”, taking the public to Brazil, “where the nostalgia shared by humanity echoes in automatic translations for various languages”. There are also, associated with the video, the new publication entitled “Entrevista, MięDzy-Wizje. Roz-Mowa, disorder”, which is “in the form of Flipbook with Luso-Polaco glossary, which deconstructs an excerpt from the recording to reflect on each word said and the limits and possibilities of translation”. item.title: Japan Sea | Seoul rescues four North Koreans on boat
item.description: South Korea announced yesterday that it rescued four North Koreans whose boat was allegedly drift in territorial waters in the Japan Sea. The South Korean navy “detected a small North Korean wooden boat about 100 kilometers from the coast of Goseong”, on the east coast of South Korea, a military spokesman said. According to South Korean news agency Yonhap, the rescued had apparently crossed the sea border accidentally and asked to be returned to North Korea. The four were delivered "to the competent [South Korean authorities]," the military said, adding that the incident happened in May. North Korean deserters are usually subject to interrogation by South Korean security services. "If they wish to return to North Korea, we will guarantee rapid and safe repatriation for humanitarian reasons," said South Korean Unification Ministry. Seul said he is still awaiting a Pyongyang response about two North Korean repatriation found in similar circumstances for three months in the Yellow Sea, located between China, North Korea and South Korea. In the inaugural speech on Wednesday, South Korea's new center-left president Lee Jae-Myung said he wanted to approach North Korea in a speech that contrasts with the hard line of the deposed predecessor Yoon Suk-Youol.

This was written during the Ming Dynasty and published in 1570, about the time when the Lusíadas de Luís Vaz de Camões, the Camonian epic, would be edited in 1572. In the western pilgrimage, we are looking for an imaginary recreation of a group of pilgrims, headed by the monk of the Tang Xuanzang Dynasty (唐玄奘 Xuánzàng), to conquer a new spiritual world, that of Buddhist religion, to which the Chinese should adhere to a better ethical-moral conduct for a much-diverted population of good teachings and conduct. Those who lead the initiative to free the Chinese from suffering is, of course, the deity of compassion, Guanyin (观音 Guānyīn), always attentive to all distressed souls, ready to launch their help. Already in the case of Os Lusíadas, composed by Luís Vaz de Camões (1524/5-1580), a journey is also narrated, but it is real, inseparable from spiritual and religious aspects, because made in the name of the universality of the Christian faith, but being inseparable from the concrete journey, which implies the very human and Renaissance conquest of a better world for people, in which the Portuguese can not the Portuguese Just survive, but command and imperate, because they are worthy of an old history and very valuable warriors. Therefore, the heroism of the discoveries, living in the Christian faith, but accompanied and protected by the Renaissance Belling that recovers the classic spirit and deities, such as the protective Venus, a loving deity that sails for the Portuguese, and the aggressive and jealous Bacchus, the god of wine who wants to lose them. The west pilgrimage by the Chinese is performed in the name of collective liberation and salvation, through contact with Buddhist sutras; The Portuguese “pilgrimage” to the east is also in the name of a collectivity, saves souls and extends to the whole land, given the proselytist vocation of Christianity and globalizing merchants, as well as the navigators, Camões his poetic herald desires the spread of faith by a great empire built by Portuguese heroes, as read in the first resort of singing first: The weapons and the barons marked That of the western Lusitana beach, By seas never of before navigadas Also passed beyond TAPROBAN, In hardworking dangers and wars, More than promised human strength, And among remote people built New kingdom, which so sublimated; That would be translated into Chinese by Zhang Weimi 张维民 in 19981 as follows: 威武的船队 ， 强悍的勇士 ， 驶离卢济塔尼亚西部海岸 ， 越过自古茫无人迹的海崖 ， 甚至跨越塔普罗瓦那海角 ， 经历千难万险、无穷战争 ， 超出人力所能承受的极限 ， 在那荒僻遥远的异域之帮 ， 将灿烂辉煌的新帝国拓建。 张维民 (译) 《卢济塔尼亚人之歌 • 第一章 ， 一》 Both pilgrimages are true poetic adventure novels, the Lusíadas in poetry, the west pilgrimage in poetic prose and poetry. In the latter, Bodhisattva Guanyin will subdue 4 monsters who will be the companions of the monk Xuanzang. Bodhisattva takes an embroidered accent and a nine -lap ring to deliver to the monk. The latter, if effectively fulfilling his 14 -year mission, escapes the wheel of reincarnation (Jenner, 1994: 60), and his disciples, disobedient divine forces falling into the human world, will be able to return to heaven, where they will again occupy divine positions. Guanyin also delivers a band, which causes terrible headaches to the disobedient King Monkey (Jenner, 1994: 60). The monsters and indomitable spirits are presented. First Sun Wukong (孙悟空 Sūn Wǔkōng), by King's disobedient monkey transits the obedient guardian of the Buddhist religion. Guanyin will free this indomitable spirit, prisoner in the mountain of the five elements (五行山 wǔxing shān), as punishment for the disobediences they have no account. Then a heavenly marshal who will pass the pig. He is Marshal Tian Peng (天篷 Tiān Péng) of the Milky Way, tried to seduce the Divinity of the Moon, was punished by the emperor of Jade with axes and condemned to exile on earth. Bodhisattva baptized him with the nickname of Zhu Bajie (猪八戒 Zhū Bājiè), which means "Pig of the eight abstinences," and gave him the name Buddhist of Zhu Wuneng (猪悟能 Zhū Wǔnéng), ie "awakening pork for power" (1994: 63). There will be an ogre that will be dominated and transformed into a sand monk. He was punished for being a distracted heavenly general. He paid the distraction with 800 whipping, having been exiled to Earth, where he devours travelers hidden in the waters of the floating river. Guanyin frees him, baptizing him with the nickname "sand" (沙 shā), and the Buddhist name of Wujing (牾净 Wǔjìng), which means "awake to purity." Follows is the son of the West Sea Dragon King who will be metamorphosed on a white horse. He was denounced by his own father for burning the bright pearls of the palace. Jade emperor punished him, suspending him in the air. He gave him 300 whips, letting him wait for death. Prince Dragon is freed to turn into the white horse of the Xuánzàng monk, or as he is known in Chinese, on the white-dragon horse, (白龙马 白龙马 Lóng Mǎ). In the term of the pilgrimage, Zhu Wuneng spiritualized, ascends to heaven, being rewarded with the heavenly position of cleans. But there are more honors to the group of victorious pilgrims who led the Sutras to China: the sand monk will receive the title of Golden Holy (Arhat), the monkey will be named Buddha of the victorious fight and the Sanzang monk will receive the title of Buddha do Merit (Buddha Candana-Punya.) As well as the white horse will rise the heavenly dragon. Proverbial popular philosophy Among the pilgrims are, as is well known, the monkey and the pig that escorts the great monk and Buddhist translator Xuanzang [唐玄奘 Xuánzàng (c. 602-664) or Sanzang (三藏 Sānzàng), the monk of the three Buddhist treasures (Buddha himself, teachings or Dharma, the monastic order or Sangha), the monastic order), Mandated by Emperor Emperor Táng Tàzōng (唐太宗, R. 626-649) to go to the Holy Scriptures from India. These will be delivered by the historic Buddha that resides in the Pico do Vulture, because "there are many greedy and evil creatures in the east, which are bought to cause suffering to others, killing and fighting nonstop." (Jenner, 1994: 58). Therefore, Buddha wanted to distribute the Scriptures through the Chinese world. In popular and proverbial philosophy, which today rushes from mouth to mouth, it is drawn to the existential duel, between two of the five pilgrims, very similar to that of the work Don Quixote, by Miguel de Cervantes (1547-1616), composed between 1605 and 1615, in which the author puts in dialogue two opposing and complementary characters, Don Quixote and Sancho Pança: Romantic, dreamer and even utopian, almost only skin and bone, as it is like an incarnate spirit; The second, materialist, realistic, pragmatic, a very strong and plump "feet". Mutatis Mutandis Zhu Bajie, the eight abstinence pig, and Sun Wugong, the west -west -awake to emptiness, have many of the opposite and complementary characteristics we find in D. Quixote and Sancho Pança. To confirm it, be aware of some of the said proverbials associated with King Monkey: 1) The seventy -two transformations of the monkey king (七十二变 qī shí èr bàn) 2) endless mutations (千变万化 qiān biàn wàn huà) 3) great confusion in the heavenly palace (大闹天宮 大闹天宮 nao tiān gōng) 4) Infinite Magic Powers (神通广大 Shéntōng-Guǎnggdà) 5) Appears and mysteriously disappears (神出鬼没 Shénchū-guǐmò) He has an infinite spiritual ability, which allows him to accompany universal movement and be in permanent transformation. It has numerous magical powers, learned from the best of Taoist masters, which enables him to successfully interfere in both the heavenly and earthly order, which is why he will be punished and only subjugated by the Buddha himself, which, tame it reveals it belongs to a superior spiritual and religious order. After a five hundred -year -old punishment, inflicted by the Buddhism patriarch, will be able to join the group of pilgrims that will successfully introduce sutras and Buddhist teachings in China. Sun Wugong reveals to be a complex and multifaceted character, retaining and enhancing the best and worst of human nature in his portentous intelligence, challenging and disobedient. It has a lot of difficulty in dealing with Zhu Bajie, for the stupidity and lust of the partner, always ready to sloth out and surrender to exclusively carnal pleasures. Zhu Bajie embodies some of the typical defects of human nature that are well revealed in popular proverbial philosophy, as can be seen by some of the said mentioned: 1) Zhū Bájiè fails and never assumes his responsibilities (豬八戒上陈 Zhū Bájiè Shàng Chén) 2) Zhu Bajie is adorned with flowers (豬八戒戴花 Zhū Bájiè dài huā). 3) Zhū Bájiè is the mirror (CZHū Bájiè Kàn Jìngzi) 4) Zhū Bájiè departed by plane (豬八戒坐飞机 Zhū Bájiè Zuò Fēijī). In the first proverb, there is the difficulty of the pig to assume guilt whenever it makes mistakes, and how to make mistakes is human, there are no accounts at the times when shaking responsibilities; Already in the second is denounced a very characteristic defect between the people, the vanity, that is, the constant need for ornaments, and not only from the physical point of view, because here not only counts the clothing but also the titles, positions and honors, in a total inability to strictly self -evaluate. In the third said, the physical and moral fealade, which attracts complaints from others, for the lack of composure and, finally, this expression is used when someone goes to the best, but in a worse way, that is, without dignity. Finally, here are some more generally meaningful proverbs, taken from the west pilgrimage, who draw attention to the general evils of the world through the adventures of pilgrims, since, except Sun Wugong, others are very easily fooled by all kinds of monsters, demons, seductive spirits, etc., having great difficulty unraveling hypocritical behaviors in which they stumble through Journey, where they find “many guys to which they cannot see their hearts” or, in other words, abundant hypocrisy, as said (虚情假意 xū qing jiǎ yì). Therefore, they are constantly involved in sarilhos or situations that “have no feet or head”, which is literally translated into Chinese by “unequal sizes” (七长八短 qīm tea bā duān). Now in a misleading world, pilgrims are those who with good intentions go with the greatest goal of saving China, so the group finds itself in the situation of “big ship, great storm”, or as it is said in Chinese, “great tree that attracts the wind” (树大招风 shūo fēng) in a world where when virtue grows a few centimeters, so wickedness increases several meters (， ， ， ， ， ， ， Give gāo yī chǐ, mó gāo yī zhàng). Despite all the warnings, coming from popular wisdom and Romanesque adventures, the west pilgrimage and the Lusíadas end with the success of its protagonists, as the Portuguese expand around the world, Buddhism is introduced in China and all the characters in the poetic soap opera give rise to a proverbial source pedagogical. And with one hand, unfolded, often in the intimate format as a designed secret Shoujuan, the 'horizontal roll', in which a painting or handwriting is intended for the look of a single observer. In this subtle way it contributed to the creation and faithful transmission of precious literary and visual culture cherished for centuries by the use of brush. Its most commented painting «Bambus Forest between rain and fog” (horizontal roller, ink on paper, 23.1 x 113.7 cm, at the National Palace Museum in Taipei) in which one can see a bamboo of bamboo on the bank of a river, due to an allusion to the legend of faithful widows of the legendary king-Sábio who drowned on the Xiang River, after he died there, after he died there. Staining the bamboo of the banks with their tears of blood would be understood as a figuration of another faithfulness, that of marital love. And in the unique way he painted bamboo groups inserted in the landscape, a recurring theme in his works, there were those who noticed in the analogous motivation that seemed to have a singular painter named Tan Zhirui (c. 1275- Active between the end of the thirteenth century), not inscribed in traditional recorders of painters but that in Japan would be perceived as a genuine master of the art of the art of the art brush. This recognition would be attested through the words inscribed in their paintings by the prestigious master of Buddhism Chan, known by his monastic name Yishan Yining (1247-1317) which can be translated as "preferably a mountain." Tan Zhirui is the author of an unusual little painting showing bamboo in the snow (ink on paper, 31.5 x 20.6 cm in Smithonian) where Yishan Yining wrote the poem: «In the cold snow, scarcely scattered, A vertical and compact jades. Throughout the winter period, The dense woods shines, sparkling. » Contrary to the classic representation of isolated bamboo growing up clinging to rocks, a formula that refers to the straight personality of Junzi, the 'just man', here the bamboo will refer to the ring in common life in monasteries. Guan Daosheng would evoke his own children when writing, along with his painting: “The day you left, Bambus had just been planted,/ The bamboo growing up became a woods, you have not yet returned./ My face of jade disbursement can hardly be restored,/ unlike flowers that fall to new flowering.

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: The US bank citigrigoup fired about 3,500 technology division employees in mainland China, as part of a global cost reduction strategy and operational restructuring, Jornal Financial Times said yesterday. The cuts affect a division based in the cities of Shanghai and Dalian, responsible for the provision of computer services to Citigroup operations in more than 20 countries. According to the bank, some of the jobs will be relocated to other countries, "to be closer to the business and products they support," without, however, revealing numbers or concrete destinations. The financial institution also indicated that the process should be completed "at the beginning of the fourth quarter." "Although there is still work to do, many of our efforts have enabled the efficiency of our way of operating, our workforce and the global presence in infrastructure," said Marc Luet, Citi's head to Japan, North Asia and Australia, quoted by the Financial Times. The bank, which has been present in mainland China since 1902, has ensured that the decision will not have an impact on the banking operations of its Chinese subsidiary, headquartered in Shanghai, nor the Canton -based technology team that continues to provide services to mainland China and Hong Kong. Third largest United States Bank in terms of assets, Citigroup has sought to resolve persistent operational and profitability challenges through deep restructuring, which included the dismissal of thousands of workers and a simplification of the management structure. This cut represents one of the largest discharges recorded between foreign financial groups in China in recent years, and reflects a growing trend of frame reduction in the technological area.

item.title: Cooperation | A look at the approach to Spanish -speaking countries
item.description:
The MSAR was already approaching Spain, but the chief executive began to refer to official speeches the importance of cooperation between Macao and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as the usual Lusophone world. Analysts relate these words to the current panorama of relations between China and Spain
The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, has expressed in some discourses the importance of having to establish economic and commercial relations not only with Portuguese -speaking countries, but also with Spanish -speaking ones. Last month, on a public occasion, the government leader stated that the territory has to "welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao." Sam Hou Fai highlighted the area of ​​advanced technology, stressing that “they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries” because “as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome,” he added. Moreover, after the inauguration of the new government, Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, made, in March, a visit to several European countries, leading a delegation that passed through Spain, Portugal, Belgium and Monaco to deepen “international links and explore opportunities for cooperation”, according to official information released at the time. This approach to the Spanish -language universe, in addition to the usual connection already established between China and the Lusophone world, can have several origins: the growing relationship between China and Spain, as well as the desire to diversify the economy by MSAR, say analysts contacted by HM. “The interpretation of Sam Hou Fai Declaration is very objective and pragmatic and can be summed up to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Portuguese-speaking countries. But the fact is that companies and institutions in Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in response to this need for Macao. For cooperation it seems logical to me, ”said economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, former resident of Macao and president of the Friends Association of the New Seda Route (ARS). According to the leader, “Macau is a pure market economy, is classified by the World Trade Organization as a free port with its own international agreements both in the economic, commercial, investment, financial, health, sports, sports, international relations agreements with various organizations. Therefore, the business in Macau is very free, and the part of the government of Macau is to promote and frame this opening”. "As Sam Hou Fai says, all companies and investors who bring Macao economy diversification solutions are welcome," he added. To Cátia Miriam Costa, professor at ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, and specialist in Chinese foreign policy and Macao, considered the HM that “this connection to the Spanish stems from the high -level official visits made by the Spanish government to China, that is, there is certainly one of the consequences of the repeated presence of Spanish diplomacy on a very high level, reinforcing the ties between the two. countries ”. item.title: EU has to be “much more vocal” about Israel in Gaza
item.description: Former European doctor Elisa Ferreira demanded yesterday to the European Union to be “much more vocal” about the boundaries that Israel “is surpassing” in the war against Hamas, defending an articulated voice of the community bloc. "Europe, even because of all the defense of human rights, has to be much more vocal to saying to Israel that it cannot exceed the boundaries it is exceeding, and that current international agreements do not allow certain actions," Elisa Ferreira said in statements to Lusa after a conference at the Consulate General of Portugal in Macau. However, the academic noted that Member States have never attributed competencies to the European Union in defense that allow it, for example, to intervene with armament in cases of country invasions. "That said, many countries-Ireland, Spain-they moved a lot, and I think there is a joint and joint voice to prevent us with a sense of impotence in the face of deaths that are absolutely unacceptable in the 21st century," said the former Minister of the Environment (1995-1999) and territorial planning (1999-2002) in the governments of António Guterres. Elisa Ferreira stressed that there have already been “there were some expressions of this will” by Lisbon and expects “to keep up”. PEACE STEPS In late May, Slovenia, Spain, Ireland and Norway, who recognized the Palestinian state a year ago, appealed to all countries to do the same compared to Palestine and Israel, as it is a necessary step for peace in the region. "We remember that recognition is another step towards the implementation of the solution of both states and we appeal to the international community to take the necessary steps to make it a reality, among them, the individual recognition of Palestine and Israel by the countries that have not yet done it," reads a "joint statement." Israel's retaliation for Hamas' attack on October 7 caused more than 54,000 dead, the destruction of almost all Gaza strip infrastructures and the forced displacement of hundreds of thousands of people. Elisa Ferreira wants to look for new partners like China Former European doctor Elisa Ferreira defended Lusa yesterday that the European Union must rethink partnerships and look for new interlocutors, including Beijing, to keep “a great actor” on the international scenario. "If there is an opportunity in every crisis, as I think the Chinese say, there is also an opportunity in this US leadership crisis, because it has shown us that Europe has to know where it wants to go and not lose control over its own agenda, and, on the other hand, it has to diversify partners abroad," said the former Portuguese minister in Macao, after a conference at Consulate General. In the current context of instability, China “has to be a great partner,” said the academic. "China is a great power. I think it has always been latent, now it is completely affirmed, especially in future areas, in stories of new digital and environmental technologies." "For a long time, Europe wanted to be driving out of new clean energy, energy savings technologies, etc.; I think China, when it defines it, when it determines, when it is organized, accelerates with an unstoppable speed," he noticed. In Macao at an invitation from the Institute of European Studies, Elisa Ferreira inaugurated yesterday the “conversations in the Consulate” cycle, with the lecture “Portugal: from the successes of the democratic Portugal to the crossroads of the present”.

item.title: Environment | Macau registers a new maximum temperatures in 2024
item.description:
The direction of environmental protection services yesterday launched new data on the environmental landscape in the territory, in the Macao Encounters of the Macao 2024. The data is not encouraging: last year a new record of maximum temperatures, more rain and typhoons were recorded. More electricity and water was spent, more garbage was produced and fewer recyclable waste was collected
Lame The Government of Macao, through the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) announced yesterday that 2024 reached a maximum temperature record in the territory, and there was also an increase in typhoons and precipitation. According to the Macau 2024 state report, the average temperature last year was 23.6 ° C, precisely the value that had been reached in 2019, the highest since the records began, in 1952. The average temperature of 2024 was 0.8 ° C higher than the average climacteric (average of 30 years, between 1991 and 2020), according to the document prepared by DSPA. In addition, Macau registered 42 days considered to be hot last year, more 10.7 days than the climacteric average, 29 hot nights, more 17.5 than the average, and 29 cold days, less 10.1 days than the average. Meteorological and geophysical services (SMG) classify as hot days when the maximum temperature is equal to or greater than 33ºC and the nights at which the minimum temperature is at least 28ºC. As for the days considered cold, they are those at which the minimum temperature does not exceed 12ºC. "With global warming, the occurrence of extreme weather phenomena is increasingly frequent," said DSPA in the report. In 2024, Macau was affected by seven tropical cyclones, known as tuffons, and for the first time three tropical cyclones affected Macao in November, the last month of the Typhoons, which begins in May. According to the report, the region last year received a total precipitation of 2,029.2 millimeters, "slightly higher than the climacteric average." DSPA also said that since 1970, sea level in Macao has risen at an average rate of about 3.5 millimeters per year. Also worldwide, 2024 was the hottest year that there are records and exceeded for the first time the 1.5 ° C above the pre-industrial level, in January the copernicus European service advanced in January. Last week, the world weather organization predicted that temperatures should continue to reach record values ​​by the end of the decade. More people, more expenses The DSPA report also tells that with the arrival of more tourists to Macau, there were also more waste and spending on water consumption, for example. "With the improvement of the economy, the number of visitors in 2024 increased 23.8 percent in annual terms for almost 35 million, having recovered about 90 percent of the pre-pound level. Tourist intensity also registered a certain increase, with GDP [Gross Domestic Product] climbed 8.8 percent. In addition, there was a slight increase in the population at the end of the year." Thus, it is added, "in relation to environmental indicators, economic and population growth led to the rise of estimated local emissions of greenhouse gases, invoiced water volume, electricity consumption and the amount of urban solid waste, compared to 2023". "During the pandemic, there was a decrease in the various economic and environmental indicators. However, with the constant improvement of the economy, most of these indicators rose again," is explained. With regard to the volume of invoiced water, in thousands of cubic meters, by 2023 the record was 89,164 and last year, 94.123, which constitutes an increase of 5.6 percent. Regarding electricity consumption, in millions of kW/h, in 2023 it was 5,740, while in 2024 consumption went to 6,030, plus 5.1 percent. The report also highlights the tons of urban solid waste produced, which in 2023 was 501,512, rising 5.1 percent last year to 526,979 tons. Another worrying fact of waste level was the fall, for the third consecutive year, the volume of recyclable waste collected, which went from 24.5 percent at 2021 to 21.7 percent last year. Changed for kids, of all recyclable waste generated in Macao, only about one fifth are collected for recycling. In the report, IP Kuong Lam, director of DSPA, indicates that last year, "with the ongoing economic recovery, there was greater pressure on various environmental indicators, while climate change became more severe." Despite the results, the official said that the objectives are "to encourage greater participation of the population in environmental initiatives and together to achieve the view of building a macao with low carbon emissions." A question of gases The report released yesterday by DSPA also accounts for the panorama of greenhouse gases (GHG) gases, and last year, a global increase of “about ten percent, including carbon dioxide (C02), which represented 90 percent”. It also highlights DSPA that “the estimated emissions of GHE from the various sources have registered upon the same period (2023), except for landfill residues, and the most significant increases were verified in estimated emissions from local electricity production and air transport”. In addition, it is stated that, in 2024, the main source of Emission of GHG and CO2 was land transport, followed by local electricity production, waste incineration, trade, domestic consumption and services. "The main sources of CH4 emissions [methane] were the waste deposited in landfills and the treatment of wastewater, while the latter was also the main source of N2O emission [nitrous oxide]," he stresses in the document. DSPA clarifies, regarding the tendency of GHG emissions, that "after reaching the peak in 2017, local Emissions of GHG showed a decreasing tendency, year after year, having reached its lower value during the pandemic." However, with the recovery of economic activities and the great movement of people, especially "in the last two years, the estimated emissions of these gases has gradually rise again." The air we breathe Also with regard to air quality data is not encouraging, because in 2024 “the number of days with the average quality of air classified as 'good' or 'moderate' recorded in the six Macao air quality monitoring stations reached 88 percent, slightly lower than 2023”. There was, in a total of the year, 15 to 34 days with “unhealthy” classification, and only two days obtained the classification of “very unhealthy”. According to DSPA, “the pollutants detected in the air monitoring stations were mainly ozone (O3) and thin particles suspended (PM2.5)”, while “at Berma da Estrada station (Ká-Hó), the highest index detected all year round, classified as 'very unhealthy', was the O3 the main pollutant”. Last year, July was the best air quality month, while October to December obtained the worst qualification according to data from Macao air monitoring stations. The report also reveals that “in terms of compliance with atmospheric pollutant concentrations in 2024, average annual PM10 and PM2.5 concentrations recorded in the various monitoring stations were lower than standard values”, while “the average annual nitrogen dioxide concentrations (NO2) also set below standard values, except for Road Berma measures (Macao) and at the High Density Areas station (Macau) ”. More optimistic data is also revealed “daily averages of sulfur dioxide concentrations (SO2) and the maximum averages of eight hours of carbon monoxide concentrations (CO) verified in the various stations throughout the year”, as “both were below standard values”. “In all seasons there was a record of the maximum averages of eight hours of O3 concentrations to exceed standard values ​​in some days. In relation to atmospheric pollutant concentrations recorded in the monitoring stations, generally the average annual concentrations of PM2.5 and NO2, while PM10 and CO descended”, and “as in the road station season (Macao) Only in 2024 did SO2 and O3 begin to be monitored, no comparisons were made. ”

item.title: Dsal | Number of work accidents suffers slight breakdown in annual terms
item.description: Data related to occupational accidents last year reveal stability compared to 2023: about five thousand people, 5,095, suffered accidents at work, slightly less than 5,293 victims of 2023, while the number of deadly victims arising from these incidents remained in a dozen Photo: Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro Data released on Friday by the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL) show how in the space of one year, between 2023 and 2024, the work accident panorama remained stable, and even a light break in the number of occurrences and the same number of dead. According to the report related to 2024, a total of 5,095 workers suffered an accident at work, and the main cause was the “fall of people”, which represented the 25.4 percent bar of the total of incidents, followed by the “raising in or between objects”, which represented 19.3 percent of all incidents, and the “march or shock in objects”, with 16.1 percent. According to the DSAL report released last year, there were 5,293 victims of occupational accidents in 2023, and almost all occurrences (5,253) resulted in temporary work disability. Only 30 cases resulted in the person's permanent disability, and 10 people died. Last year, DSAL also recorded the same number of deaths from occupational accidents, and a case is associated with an alleged “infringement of occupational safety and health legislation”. "All mortal cases were sent to the court organs for due processing, and, later, DSAL will adjust the data in accordance with the judgments given," reads the report relating to 2024. DSSA says investigations to all labor incidents, having applied fines to two entities for “infringements to occupational safety and health” in cases involving two workers. In addition, fines to 43 persons were applied for infringement of the legal regime of reparation for emerging damages of occupational accidents and occupational diseases, involving 303 workers in total. More men than women The report also presents more specific data on occupational accidents last year. Thus, of the 5,095 cases, 5,063 resulted in temporary disability, and 557 workers managed to return to service on the same day of the occurrence of the accident highlights DSal. However, a total of 22 people ended up having permanent disability. Noteworthy is the number of people who were hit in the hands (1,336), followed by accidents in the feet zone with 894 occurrences, various parts of the body with 831 cases, and accidents in the trunk zone with 743 cases. Statistical data also show that men dominate with regard to victims: thus, in 2024, 255 victims aged between 16 and 24 years. In this age group, 165 men suffered occupational accidents as opposed to 90 women. The numbers rise in people aged 25 to 44, in which there were 2,719 occurrences, reaching 1,568 men and 1,151 women. From 45 to 64 there were 1,908 occurrences, this time having reached more women than men: 1,188 compared to 720 male workers. Highlight for 213 cases of occupational accidents involving people at renovation age, ie 65 years or older, where 120 women were affected in contrast with 93 men. The 2024 data also look at the type of profession in which more accidents occurred: dominate the “administrative employees”, with 1,318 cases, followed by the “staff of services, sellers and similar work”, with 1,207 cases, as well as “unqualified workers” with 1,219 occurrences. There were also 413 occurrences in the group of “workers of industrial production and artisans” and 196 in “operators of machines, drivers and assemblers”. In the category of “intermediate level technicians and professionals” 420 work incidents were recorded. Let's go by parts If we look at the numbers of occupational accidents taking into account the branch of economic activity, it is observed that they dominate “cultural and recreational activities, lottery and other services”, therefore, to the game and entertainment sector, with 1,512 cases occurred last year. Following are accidents in “hotels, restaurants and the like”, with 1,293 cases, as well as 414 incidents in the area of ​​“transport, storage and communications”. In the construction sector, there were 374 accidents. It should be noted that the 2023 data is also similar in terms of economic activity where more work accidents occurred and in terms of the gender of workers, with 52 percent of men and 48 percent of affected women. In 2023, there was a higher incidence of occupational accidents in ages between 25 and 44 years, representing 53.6 percent, while at the age of 45 and 64 years, the percentage of accidents lowered to 37.2 percent. The 2023 DSal report also showed that “cultural and recreational activities, lottery and other services” (29.5 percent), “hotels, restaurants and the like” (23.2 percent) and “transport, storage and communications” (10.8 percent) occupied the first three positions compared to the total number of occupational accident victims. Regarding the professions, the “unqualified workers” (26 percent), the “staff of services, sellers and similar workers” (24 percent) and the “administrative employees” (22.9 percent) occupied the first three positions in relation to the total victims of occupational accidents. Action and reaction The 2024 DSA DSA report also reveals that 3,550 inspection visits were made to different workplaces, such as construction shipyards, industrial and commercial establishments, which resulted in 395 improvement recommendations and fines in 10 situations due to lack of safety. Last year, four suspensions of the operation of shipyards were ordered in the context of occupational safety and health verification, the most serious consequence after the application of fines or awareness. Dsal also points out that, last year, 404 seminars were performed for different sectors and types of work, which had the participation of 17,148 people. Regarding courses on occupational safety and health, formations were carried out to obtain the occupational security card in the construction, with 26,590 participants, which resulted in the issuance of 25,069 cards. The “Safety Training Courses in Specific Construction Works” had 3,167 participants, and 2,895 certificates were issued. In another important area for the local economy, hotel and restoration, 25,965 participants participated in the “training courses to obtain the occupational safety card in hotel and restoration”, with the issuance of 25,020 cards.

item.title: Physical Fitness | Study shows good results in preschool children
item.description:
One study analyzed the physical fitness of preschool children in Macao. The results point to “modest growth and development”, “small increases in height and weight” and “improvements in speed, agility, muscle strength and flexibility”, thanks to the 2015 curriculum reform that bet on school sports
The government is to be congratulated with regard to sports in preschool, according to an academic study that evaluated children of kindergartens and statistical data of their physical fitness provided by the Institute of Sport (ID). In "Temporal Trends of Physical Fitness in MSAR preschool children between 2002 and 2020", published in the Journal of Exercise & Fitness, academics point to "modest growth and development among preschool students." Statistically evaluated parameters focus on performance in activities such as running, length jump or march. The work is by SIU Ming Choi, Faculty of Education, Grant R. Tomkinson, Justin J. Lang, Cristina Cadenas-Sanchez, Haoyu Dong, Si Man Lei, Eric Tsz Chun Poon, the latter linked to the Department of Sports Sciences and Physical Education at the Chinese University of Hong Kong. The authors have taken the annual ID data to realize how the children's body has evolved in recent years, allowing you to perceive data related to weight, height and body measurements. Thus, it is read that there were “small increases in height, weight and circumferences, improvements in speed-agility, muscle strength and flexibility of the lower body and flexibility, and declines in the muscle power of the upper body and equilibrium capacity”. The study reveals "significant but small increases at the time, weight and circumference of the chest," while "the physical aptitude trends were contradictory, with declines ranging from insignificant to small throwing and equilibrium performance." There were also “insignificant improvements to small in other measures” of the body, with the authors to point out that “no significant differences were found between genres, which indicates equitable development” between boys and girls. In general terms, “an increase in body size and modest but significant improvements in various components of physical fitness, such as speed-agility, muscle power, and flexibility, and flexibility, and declines elsewhere” were recorded. The authors consider that these results “can be attributed to a combination of factors of the education system and the domestic environment”, as “the Macao Education System and the curriculum guidelines have given priority to the development of physical education and the acquisition of motor skills”. It is also noteworthy that Macau was "the first region of China to incorporate kindergarten into its free education system since 2007, making the education of its residents a fundamental priority." The study also mentions the 2015 curriculum reform, which “explicitly emphasizes learning fundamental movement skills, such as locomotor (walking, running, bouncing, equilibrium, trigger) and object control (launch, catch) through various physical activities and games designed by teachers”. The work emphasizes the importance of guardians in the connection of children with sport, remembering the pandemic years. “Parents' positive influence on the modeling of physical activity can also play a role in these improvements, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, when children had less opportunities for physical activity away from home.” Academics emphasize that it is important, for the authorities, to make a “continuous monitoring” and “support the physical fitness and overall health in early childhood”, and there must be “strategies to improve global physical fitness in early childhood”. Jump and jump For this study, data from children between the age of three and the age of five were analyzed in preschool, in 2002, 2005, 2010, 2015 and 2020, such as body size, with regard to height, weight and circumferences of the chest, waist and hip; And physical fitness, such as the 2 × 10 m shot, foot length heel, marching, continuous two -legged heel, head throttle and sitting and reaching. ” In addition, "preschool children were recruited from macau's six kindergarten through a combination of stratified and group random sampling methods." A total of 4,519 children, with 59 percent boys and 41 percent girls participated. The results reveal “an equitable improvement of physical fitness” and the data put Macau at a better position on some European countries referred to in the study. “In contrast to previous investigations into the trends of the physical development of children and adolescents in Poland, which revealed stability at the time, but increases in weight and body mass index, our results suggest that macao preschool children have increased in size, perhaps due to the best living and nutritional conditions.” Academics conclude that "results are particularly significant," and point out that "the improvement observed in the performance of the standing length of the pre-school of Macau is encouraging." Such "contrasts with the investigation into similar populations in the Czech Republic and Poland, where declines were reported in the performance in the length of standing length with increases in the body mass index and in the cutaneous fold," is indicated. Other signs The study also reveals “a temporal improvement of flexibility in Macao preschoolers, which differs from the trends observed in pole preschoolers”, and there are “cultural, environmental factors or other factors that influence the development of flexibility in young children in different regions and populations”. The work also points out that the masters “mixtures uniquely mix eastern and western cultures, which turns it into an intriguing scenario to examine trends in the physical fitness of preschool children”. It is also noted that "the region has a strong commitment to education, offering 15 years of free preschool education to high school and secondary education, ensuring broad access to education and development programs in early childhood childhood for all children." The compliments of the academics continue, stressing the “remarkable life expectancy, which exceeds 84 years in 2019”, and “Macao gave priority to their health and social systems”. “Recognizing the importance of physical health, standardized and systematic physical fitness tests were performed on people of all ages since the beginning of the century, when the government implemented a physical fitness surveillance system aligned with China's national physical fitness monitoring,” is also explained.

item.title: Crime | “Illicit game” with an increase of more than 900 percent
item.description:
The changes to the “Law on Combating Unlawful Game Crimes”, which added the crime of illegal exchange, led to more occurrences. Only in a year was there an increase of 906.3 percent of crimes associated with the “illicit game”. The data are related to the first quarter of this year and were released yesterday by Secretary Wong Sio Chak
The law has changed and the crime increased. It was like this with the illegal exchange rate in casinos, as the activity began to be criminalized by the change to the “law to combat illicit gaming crimes” last year. According to the balance of crime made yesterday, the crimes associated with the illicit game rose 906.3 percent, with 161 cases in the first quarter of this year compared to last year, growth enhanced by illegal exchange cases. The legislative change in question “led to a large increase of this type of crime, especially with regard to illegal exchange,” was mentioned. In adding the crime of “illicit exchange exchange for game”, it was thus adjusted “the scope of coverage of some related crimes, resulting in the increase in crimes related to the illicit game”, it was added. At yesterday's press conference, Secretary for Security, Wong Sio Chak, said that police authorities will continue to “reinforce the prevention and execution work of the law”, and follow “and analyze the development of crime”. Exchanges and Baldrocas In general terms, the game -associated crimes also increased, with 567 inquiries, 216 compared to the first quarter of 2024, representing an increase of 61.5 percent. According to a press release of Wong Sio Chak's office, "it is believed that the main cause of this increase is related to the criminalization of" illegal money "," the dismantling of several relevant criminal networks in joint operations, as well as uncertain factors in society resulting from increased tourist.
